intro: Bellevalia operculata, commonly known as the hooded bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers with a distinctive hood-like structure over the throat. The flowers are typically pale blue or violet, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
